CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, March 28, 1964, pg. 2 reads: "Brotherhood Award - The Brotherhood Award for the most outstanding non-Irish marching group in recent St. Patrick's Day parade was won by the Hill City Drill Team. Shown at the award ceremonies are (left to right) G. Harold Griffin, director of HIll City; Assistant Superintendent of Police Lawrence J. Maloney, parade chairman and marshal; Mayor Joseph M. Barr, who made the presentation; Raymond J. Harris, director of the Hill City Drill Team; Sharyn Madden, Clifford Robinson, Sherry Ware, Wilbert Boyd, Elaine Broan and Charles Humphries, all members of the drill team. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of Hill City Drill Team, from left: Clifford Robinson, Sherry Ware, Charles Humphries, Elaine Brown, Wilbert Boyd, and Sharyn Madden, posed in city office
